Test steps:
INITIAL CONDITIONS
1. You must have a bookmarks file.
2. To promote consistency, you may choose to use the default set of Netscape Seamonkey Bookmarks.
3. You also have the option to use this very large bookmarks file.
4. You must also customize your sidebar to include a bookmarks panel.

STEPS/DESCRIPTION
1. Open the Manage Bookmarks Window.
2. Edit|Cut or Edit|Copy any bookmark.
3. Select the 'Personal Toolbar Folder'. Double-click it or single-click the triangle to open the folder.
4. Select Edit|Paste.
5. Go to a browser window and click once on the new link in the personal toolbar.

EXPECTED RESULTS
1. The bookmark you added should appear immediately on the personal toolbar in a browser window and be activated by a single click.
2. It should also be present as a subitem under "Personal Toolbar Folder" in the toplevel Bookmarks menu, in the bookmarks popup within the personal toolbar itself, and in the bookmarks sidepanel.

LINKS
1. default-bookmarks.html
2. large-bookmarks.html

STEPS/DESCRIPTION
1. Launch the browser
2. From the Sidebar, select "Tabs | Customize Sidebar"
3. From the window that opens up, select and click on any panel from the panel titled "Available Panels"
4. The "Preview..." button should be highlighted
5. Clicking on the "Preview..." button should open up a window titled "Panel Preview" and showing how the panel looks
6. Pressing the "x" button on top right of the window should close the preview window

EXPECTED RESULTS
Panels can be previewed

INITIAL CONDITIONS
1. All of the browser's toolbars(3) must be visible.
2. Make sure they are all visible by selecting the top level "View" menu and looking at the Toolbars submenu. The Navigation Toolbar, Personal Toolbar, and Taskbar should all have checks next to their names.

STEPS/DESCRIPTION
1. Select Bookmarks|Manage Bookmarks.
2. Open the "Personal Toolbar Folder". Add a new folder to it, File|New Folder.
3. Open and add a new bookmark, File|New Bookmark to the folder you just created.
4. Select the new bookmark and edit its properties, Edit|Bookmark Properties, changing the url to http://www.mozilla.org.
5. Go back to the browser window and click on the New Folder in the personal toolbar. Click the New Bookmark item.

EXPECTED RESULTS
1. The New Folder should appear in the personal toolbar.
2. The link within the New Folder on the personal toolbar should function normally.
